instruction: Write a CSound instrument that demonstrates the PADsynth algorithm
output:
<CsoundSynthesizer>
<CsOptions>
-odac
</CsOptions>
<CsInstruments>

sr = 44100
kr = 4410
ksmps = 10
nchnls = 2
0dbfs = 1

; PADsynth creates bandwidth-enhanced additive synthesis
; Generate PADsynth wavetable
giPad1 ftgen 1, 0, 262144, "padsynth", 1, 440, 40, 1, 1, 0.5, 0.3, 0.2, 0.1
giPad2 ftgen 2, 0, 262144, "padsynth", 1, 440, 80, 1, 1, 0.5, 0.3, 0.2, 0.1

; Standard sine for reference
giSine ftgen 3, 0, 16384, 10, 1

instr 1
    ; padsynth opcode concept:
    ; PADsynth generates wavetables with bandwidth-enhanced harmonics
    ; This creates rich, "wide" sounds suitable for pads
    ; Parameters: base_freq, bandwidth, harmonics...
    
    iAmp = 0.4
    iFreq = p4
    
    ; Use PADsynth wavetable
    aOsc poscil iAmp, iFreq, giPad1
    
    outs aOsc, aOsc
endin

instr 2
    ; Wide bandwidth PADsynth
    iAmp = 0.4
    iFreq = p4
    
    ; Wider bandwidth = richer sound
    aOsc poscil iAmp, iFreq, giPad2
    
    outs aOsc, aOsc
endin

instr 3
    ; Comparison with regular sine
    iAmp = 0.4
    iFreq = p4
    
    aSine poscil iAmp, iFreq, giSine
    
    outs aSine, aSine
endin

instr 4
    ; PADsynth with filter sweep
    iAmp = 0.4
    iFreq = p4
    
    aOsc poscil iAmp, iFreq, giPad1
    
    ; Sweep filter
    kCutoff expseg 500, p3, 5000
    aFilt butterlp aOsc, kCutoff
    
    outs aFilt, aFilt
endin

instr 5
    ; Detuned PADsynth layers
    iAmp = 0.3
    iFreq = p4
    
    ; Three layers slightly detuned
    aOsc1 poscil iAmp, iFreq*0.998, giPad1
    aOsc2 poscil iAmp, iFreq, giPad1
    aOsc3 poscil iAmp, iFreq*1.002, giPad1
    
    aMix = (aOsc1 + aOsc2 + aOsc3) * 0.4
    
    outs aMix, aMix
endin

</CsInstruments>
<CsScore>

; Play narrow bandwidth
i1 0 3 220
i1 3.5 3 330

; Play wide bandwidth
i2 7.5 3 294

; Compare with sine
i3 11.5 2 440

; Play with filter
i4 14.5 4 196

; Play detuned layers
i5 19.5 5 165

e
</CsScore>
</CsoundSynthesizer>
